cause: Genetic mutation leading to a deficiency in the enzyme arginase, affecting ammonia metabolism
Genetic mutations affecting the metabolism of glutamate, a neurotransmitter in the brain
Deficiency in the enzyme glycine cleavage system, leading to an accumulation of glycine in the brain
Deficiency in enzymes involved in proline metabolism, affecting connective tissue and collagen formation
Genetic mutation leading to reduced availability of serine, an amino acid critical for brain development
Deficiency in enzymes involved in tyrosine breakdown, leading to accumulation of toxic byproducts
Deficiency in histidine, an amino acid that plays a role in various metabolic processes
Deficiency in enzymes responsible for breaking down branched-chain amino acids, leading to toxic buildup
Deficiency in the amino acid lysine, which is essential for protein synthesis and growth
Deficiency of enzymes involved in the metabolism of homocysteine, leading to toxic accumulation
Deficiency in the transport of cysteine, leading to its accumulation and formation of kidney stones
Deficiency in phenylalanine hydroxylase enzyme, which leads to the buildup of phenylalanine in the blood
Deficiency in the amino acid threonine, leading to impaired protein synthesis and growth
Deficiency in butyric acid production, which plays a role in energy metabolism and gut health
Deficiency in the enzyme responsible for metabolizing caproic acid, leading to metabolic disturbances
Deficiency in the enzyme responsible for metabolizing caprylic acid, leading to metabolic disturbances
Deficiency in enzymes responsible for fatty acid breakdown, leading to hypoglycemia, liver dysfunction, and muscle weakness
Deficiency in stearic acid, an omega-9 fatty acid, leading to abnormal lipid metabolism
Deficiency in oleic acid, an omega-9 fatty acid, leading to abnormalities in lipid metabolism
Deficiency in linoleic acid, an essential omega-6 fatty acid, leading to impaired skin function and immune deficiencies
